column5: I have a couple of Team Diawa-x 100HSDF baitcasters and would like to get them professionally clean. Anyone have any ideas on where to send them? Thanks.. GTA area would be perfect
Aikmans, we send them for customers. They always do a top notch job.  Mike
they clean shimano reels as well?
Shimano does and they do a good job, $25 fee unless it's a Stella, then your covered for life on cleanings.  Mike

anyone have experience doing cleanings for both spinning / trolling reels, including changing drag washers / drags where required?  i have about 40 something reels that I would like to get done, however, I'd prefer not to send them out... it would also be a great opportunity for me to learn....I would like to pay hourly. It likely would take a full day to do all the reels.  I'm in Hamilton.  90% of the reels are shimano. half of the reels are tekota's.  thanks
Not sure what your saying here Mike?

I asked do they service shimano and he write backs.....Shimano does and they do a good job.. implying that shimano cleans shimano reels.. You can see how most people would wonder. I just would have said... Yup they do shimano as well, and do a great job.. Kinda like what I said lol
shimano reels can be sent to the head office in peterborough for an service. they dropped aikmans as a service center due to the poor customer service they had.
good to know.. I have actually heard alot of bad this about Aikmans since inquiring.. Thanks.. Anybody ever hear of classic Sports for reel cleaning and repairs?
Angling specialties also does reel cleaning if I'm not mistaken.
